Hedonic use, stress, and life satisfaction as predictors of smartphone addiction Vujić, A., & Szabo, A. Based on the compensatory internet use theory, hedonic or non-utilitarian smartphone use might be associated with SA. The study concludes that being female, hedonic smartphone use, and perceived life stress predict SA. Behavioral addiction, Cyberchondria, Intolerance of uncertainty, Problematic smartphone Use, Smartphone addiction May 3, 2023

Properties of the Serbian Smartphone Application-Based Addiction Scale (SABAS) and Validation of the English Version Among Non-native English Speakers. Vujić, A., Volarov, M., Latas, M., Griffiths, M. D., & Szabo, A. Based on the study’s findings, the Serbian version of SABAS is a reliable and valid measure for screening the risk of smartphone addiction. Moreover, the English version can be used among non-native Serbian English speakers. Behavioural addiction, Mobile phone, Psychometric, Smartphone addiction, Validation, SABAS Mar 27, 2023

Cross–cultural Validity of the Reactive–Proactive Aggression Questionnaire Among Adults Across Five Countries Dinić, B. M., Raine, A., Vujić, A., & Van Dongen, J. D. M. This is the first study in which cross-cultural validation of the RPQ among adults has been tested and results suggested that there are some cultural differences in expression of proactive aggression.
